page.title: 03OLD RECTORY
page.content: { { }Typical of the larger houses in the area is The Old Rectory at Whiston. The house stands near Whiston Parish Church and was built by the Earl of Effingham for his son in 1840.He was the Rector of Whiston and his former Rectory was overcrowded owing to the fact that he had thirteen children. On the ground floor there are eight rooms and eight rooms on the second floor. In the attic you find the rooms where the servants used to sleep.In the cellars where slaughtered beasts were hung on a series of hooks,blood would drain through a series of channels cut in the floor.A secret passage that led to the local woods has been bricked up. The house set in extensive and beautiful grounds is a home and a base for Rotherham Saddlery,selling equestrian equipment.
